app package¶

app.main module¶

app.main.dictionary()[source]¶

Return all dictionary node from Gen3 Data Commons

app.main.download_gen3_metadata_file(program, project, uuid, format, filename)[source]¶

Return a single file for a given uuid.

Parameters:

  • program – program name.

  • project – project name.

  • uuid – uuid of the file.

  • format – format of the file (must be one of the following: json, tsv).

  • filename – name of the file.

Returns:

A JSON or CSV file containing the metadata.

app.main.download_irods_data_file(suffix)[source]¶

Return a specific download file from iRODS.

Parameters:

suffix – Required iRODS file path.

Returns:

A file with data.

app.main.download_s3_data(suffix)[source]¶

Return a single download file for a given suffix.

Parameters:

suffix – Part of the s3 location.

Returns:

The file content.

app.main.export_node(node_type)[source]¶

Return all records in a dictionary node.

Parameters:

node_type – The dictionary node to export.

Returns:

A list of json object containing all records in the dictionary node.

app.main.export_record(uuids)[source]¶

Return the fields of one or more records in a dictionary node.

Parameters:

uuids – uuids of the records (use comma to separate the uuids e.g. uuid1,uuid2,uuid3).

Returns:

A list of json object

app.main.flask()[source]¶
app.main.get_data_list(collect)[source]¶
app.main.get_gen3_header()[source]¶
app.main.get_irods_collections()[source]¶

Return collections from a folder.

“GET” method will return all collections from the root folder “POST” method will return all collections from the required folder

app.main.get_irods_session()[source]¶

This function is used to connect to the iRODS server, it requires “host”, “port”, “user”, “password” and “zone” environment variables.

app.main.get_saved_state(table)[source]¶
app.main.get_share_link()[source]¶
app.main.get_state()[source]¶
app.main.graphql_filter()[source]¶

Return filtered metadata records. The query uses GraphQL query.

app.main.health()[source]¶
app.main.is_json(json_data)[source]¶

Returns true if the given string is a valid json.

Parameters:

json_data – The input data need to be checked.

Returns:

True if the string can be parsed as valid json.

app.main.program()[source]¶

Return the program information from Gen3 Data Commons

app.main.project()[source]¶

Return all projects information in the Gen3 program

app.main.resource_not_found(e)[source]¶
app.main.s3()[source]¶

Return the s3 data from s3 url location.

app.main.spreadsheet()[source]¶

Return the spreadsheet data.
